meanings.definition: To grant or bestow (a title, degree, benefit, etc.)
meanings.sent1: The king confers knighthood on the brave knight.
meanings.sent2: The university confers degrees upon its graduates every year.
meanings.sent3: The magical wand confers the power of invisibility to its wielder.
meanings.sent4: Hard work confers success like a crown upon the diligent.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact confers immortality to whoever possesses it.

meanings.sent1: The students confer about the upcoming school event.
meanings.sent2: Colleagues often confer before making important decisions.
meanings.sent3: The siblings confer on which movie to watch this weekend.
meanings.sent4: The politicians confer on the best strategy for the upcoming election.
meanings.sent5: Friends confer on the best vacation destination for their next trip.

meanings.definition: To consult together; compare opinions; carry on a discussion or deliberation
meanings.sent1: The jury must confer to reach a unanimous decision.
meanings.sent2: The team will confer to decide the next course of action.
meanings.sent3: The family will confer on where to go for their summer vacation.
meanings.sent4: The experts will confer to analyze the data and draw conclusions.
meanings.sent5: The council will confer to address the community's concerns.
